reviews.review_msg: Kimberly was a *GREAT* teacher. She took a conceptually difficult course and made it clear, accessible and fun. She genuinely wanted her students to succeed, and really worked hard to provide support on webCT and through office hours. A++++ to Kim.
The best instructor at UBC (teaches at UBC & SFU). Clear, interesting, funny, and super nice. You can tell that she really enjoys teaching and she is very good at it.
UBC summer course. Awesome prof. Clear, reasonable, helpful. Respectful towards students. Sets the bar high for other instructors. Highly recommended.

Took this course in the summer and it was a disaster.
His lectures are extremely boring and slow. The exams are extremely hard with mt 59%avg no scaling and final ~55% avg before scaling. Does not know how the final will scale by this point. Final+mt is worth 60%. No practice for the final. Prairie learn questions were not similar to the final.
Outstanding professor, explains things extremely well!

Excellent Professor, taught the content well and took time to make sure to answer questions after some hard concepts. went to his office hours and he was patient and answered my questions in a nice manner. Although there were a few assignments that was tough, the rest and the exams were alright as long as you were listening and doing the practice.

This guy is the least responsive instructor I've ever seen. He gives too long C++ assignments and does not care about his students. The assignments are almost the same as CS 225 of Illinois University. He is also quite rude when you go to his office hours. Avoid taking his course at all cost. There are many other good instructors in UBC.

He is the best cs prof at UBC I had ever met. His lecture ppt and notes are clear and pretty helpful. He makes a very hard course easier. I definitely recommend you to take his classes. Really nice guy.
Geoff is amazing. His lecture slides are perfect and super helping. He makes every concept very clear and straightforward. He is by far the best instructor in Comp Sci department.

Good professor. Got through the material, sometimes got lost in his own examples and lecture slides. For 221, lots of online material and lots of other resources to learn the material, so lectures weren't ultra important. He was very helpful in office hours, and a pretty nice guy. NOTE: Cinda is better though.

One of the better profs I've had in my time at UBC. Lectures are very clear, very engaging with humor that's actually funny and not a desperate call for engagement. Prepares you really well for the exams.

Superb instructor! Very clear lectures with great examples and explanations. He definitely knows his stuff and can answer any questions that come up. CPSC221 as a course is fairly heavy in material by nature so I don't blame Geoff for the difficulty. Lectures are often very funny as well!

Geoff was really great! I personally thought he was one of the best lecturers I've had at UBC. He's very clear and concise with concepts and what you need to know for the course, and he patiently answers any questions that arise in class. In office hours, he'll be very determined to help you solve any problems you have!

Geoff's no doubt a great prof, and though some of my peers think he's a little monotoned, I find his lectures to be very clear and I love how he explains the difficult concepts to you as if you were an 8 year old. Super easy to follow, super easy to understand. He's accessible during his office hours, answers questions very patiently.

His lectures are very clear and concise, and he is always willing to answer questions. So the lectures become quite easy to follow. He is nice and helpful in his office hours(4 hrs per week). Take 221 with Geoff!!!!
I love him.
All around solid professor. Does a great job in lecture of explaining concepts thoroughly. Grading criteria is very detailed and fair. Would take his course again.

The assignments were fair, I guess, but the exams are ridiculous difficult. I'm not sure what I wrote on that final or how I ended up passing. I've never walked away not even understanding the exam questions.

I believe that he can be a good professor, but I think he wasn't able to manage time properly given that it was a 6 week summer course. Because of this, much of the material was rushed and I don't think he was able to gauge the level of the class come examination time and ended up giving us an insanely difficult final.

Geoff is a good professor. Had him as a sessional lecturer at UBC for our intro algorithms course. The midterm was easy but the final was hilariously difficult - I'm not sure if half the class passed before scaling. Just know how to apply the material - you can expect many coding questions on his exams.
